United Nations agrees to send observers to Syria

The UN Security Council today voted to send observers to Syria to shore up a brittle truce, even as a new surge of violence threatened the deal. (AP, 1:29 p.m.)
  • pictures Scenes from Syria's uprising

BAA to allow runners to defer to 2013 due to expected high temps for marathon

The Boston Athletic Association will keep the finish line open later and said qualified and charity runners can defer to next year due to the forecast. (Globe, 11:43 a.m.)
  • Weather wisdom Intense heat for Marathon Monday
  • Marathon day weather a hot topic  |  Forecast
CAPITALS AT BRUINS > 3 P.M. (CH. 7)

Bruins shoot for another playoff win

The Bruins started their Stanley Cup defense with a win over the Capitals on Thursday. Today, they'll look to extend their series lead to 2-0. Get updates here.
  • Chris Kelly the first link in the chain | Krejci banged up

Secret Service agents relieved of duty for alleged misconduct with prostitutes

A dozen Secret Service agents providing security for President Obama in Colombia were relieved of their duty after alleged misconduct with prostitutes. (AP, 1:49 p.m.)
  • Obama in Colombia to promote US-Latin America ties

Best Buy closes its Back Bay
and Wareham stores

Both Massachusetts stores will open on Sunday for final sales and will close permanently on May 12, the electronics retailer announced today. (Globe, 1:25 p.m.)

Woman who died in Greenland, N.H. standoff had dated gunman

The 26-year-old woman killed in the standoff had dated the gunman on and off and was recently helping him sort through issues, her mother said. (AP, 12:48 p.m.)
  • Greenland, N.H., police chief recalled  |  Pictures
  • Alleged Greenland, N.H. shooter had history of mayhem

The rise and fall of
white bread

Aaron Bobrow-Strain’s new book "White Bread" examines the history of the “most fought-over food” in American history.

The city's public orchards are a wealth of local produce and are free for all to pick.

They dread the running clothes, but, deep down, kids take pride in parents who persevere up Heartbreak Hill and raise thousands of dollars for charities.
G Force

Stella Starsky and Quinn Cox will perform their peculiar brand of cosmic cabaret on Wednesday.
Television Review

‘Girls’ brings grimaces, grins

“Girls” is an angsty, younger bizarro take on “Sex and the City,” as viewers tag along in the lives of four very different twentysomething friends.

Banks eye Boylston Street

Boylston Street is now ground zero as banks battle for space in neighborhoods with a mix of professional workers, upscale shoppers, and wealthy residents.

Humble hero could get lofty honor

Massachusetts’s two US senators are pushing to name a warship after Thomas J. Hudner Jr., who crashed his own plane to save another aviator.
